name: The Westin Cincinnati

reviews.title: Nice hotel but rooms need upgrading
reviews.text: Nice hotel and could be 5 star but there are a couple of notable misses. The hotel is right across from Fountain Square Plaza in the middle of downtown, within easy walking distance to a number of good restaurants, both casual and upscale. The first miss: when I arrived in a taxi the doorman, who was chatting with a customer, couldn't be bothered to come over and help me with my luggage. Seems to me that's a pretty basic part of a doorman's job. I was left to get my luggage and enter the building wondering where reception is--turns out you have to take the escalator upstairs.

Things went better from there--the lobby is beautifully done and modern. Reception checked me in quickly and even upgraded me slightly to a room overlooking the Fountain for being a Starwood Gold member. But the room itself was the second miss: while spacious, it's definitely showing its age and is a stark contrast to the lobby downstairs. The faded carpeting and wallpaper makes the room old, especially since I noticed a patch of ripped wallpaper in an obvious place near the bed. The wooden desk and dresser look cheap and are chipped and gouged in multiple places. And a panel above the closet door was gone, so you could see into the closet. The room did have a good flat screen TV, coffee maker, small fridge and room safe and the bed was comfortable but overall I've seen nicer rooms in Courtyards and other lower budget hotels. On the plus side, I had a problem hooking up to the room internet and tech support went out of its way to help me right away. Internet is about $10 a day though it will be free for Gold members starting March 1.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The fitness room and pool is on the top (17th) floor and are nice, with good space and lighting. The fitness room has 5 Life Fitness treadmills, plus elliptical trainers, hand weights and so on, though no weight lifting stations. The pool has a hot tub and is a good size though too small for laps.
reviews.title: NEEDS UPDATING ITS TIRED.

reviews.text: If they upgraded the rooms it would be an all around great hotel.
reviews.title: Well-Priced and Well-Located

reviews.text: Great location in downtown. Great bar and good service. Rooms were average size and probably due for an update in the next couple of years. I'm not sure whether there is a business center or if it was closed, but the front desk sent me to a Fed-Ex/Kinkos which was sort of a pain. All in all - I'd probably stay here again for business or a short personal stay.
reviews.title: There are better choices

reviews.text: I live in Cincinnati and I stayed at the Westin. Its the place to stay downtown because you get the most for your money (Atleast I did). The beds are awesome but our view was the construction on Fountain Square. We used the indoor pool and gym. These are the only two things on the top floor. The gym looked brand new. My only complaint is that our shower would fill up with water to our ankles due to poor drainage and I thought the bathroon could have been a little bigger since I was staying in a huge room on the preferred floor. I will definately stay here again (and I live here).
reviews.title: Westin is Ok

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was a great deal for the price, but not up to Westin standards. The room looked worn, the bathroom twin showerhead was more of a leaky gimmick than an amentiy, and the A/C panel was rusty and loose from the wall. The bed, however, was amazing--as was the view from the Starwood Preferred floor (just too bad Fountain Square is one big construction site). Didn't have to pay for the Internet, which was a nice touch (although I expect free Internet from a luxury hotel), and the service was very friendly. Beware this place during a Bengals home game weekend--or join in the noisy festivities.
reviews.title: Very nice stay, even though not Westin-quality facilities

reviews.text: Downtown Cincy seems to be slowly awakening, and the Westin is in a primo spot with the amazing Contemporary Art Center and Arenoff Performing Arts Center within a short jaunt. Hopefully the nascent revival will spur Westin to transform this place from a dated urban-renewal project into a thriving destination with some decent restaurants and retail.
reviews.title: I love Westin!

reviews.text: Had to stay at the downtown Westin on last minute notice. I was upgraded to a King room on the "Preferred Floor". Check in was a breeze and parking was only $2 overnight on Friday. Westin has a $16 technology package for unlimited US calls and internet but is wasn't reflected on my bill. The attendant checking corrected everything. Very efficient and in a great location. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Consistant Westin Quality

reviews.text: We received this room for almost half off of the regular rate through priceline, so we thought the room was an excellent value for the price WE paid, although full price's value is a bit sketchy. Our room was clean with a great view of Fountain Square, with impeccable beds. We were disappointed to learn that the parking garage was full, and we (who had reservations) were to either pay $25 for valet or park two blocks away; not acceptable for a four-diamond hotel. Another minor gripe was water in the coffecups from the last guests, understaffing at the front desk, and a faulty showerhead in the dual-head shower. We would definitely stay here again for a discounted price, but would go elsewhere to pay full-price.
reviews.title: Great for Priceline

reviews.text: Our stay at The Westin Hotel in downtown Cincinnati was wonderful. The hotel is convenient located, close to the stadium, and just across the street there is a great steakhouse. Customer service was fabulous; the rooms were spotless and super comfortable. I definitely recommend The Westin Hotel downtown for your next trip.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: During my 40 plus years of traveling, I have stayed at many great hotels around the world, including the Westin Hotels & Resorts in N.Y.C., Seattle, Miami, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Singapore, Hong Kong, Seoul, and many others, and always had 5 * accommodations., great service, friendly personnel and excellent locations, and my recent stay with the Cincinnatii Westin, was no exception. The hotel is situated right in the center of the city, with easy reach from the airport and by car. I will recommend this hotel to all my fiends.
reviews.title: Westin, Great Hotel in Cincinnati

reviews.text: Hotel is about 20 minutes from Cincinnati Airport (which is really in Kentucky). The check in area is on the 2nd floor - no signage in sight and had to walk around and ask someone. There was one person at check in and she was friendly but not engaging. I stayed on the 5th floor in a King Bed room. Good size room with sitting chair, desk, and flat screen TV. Room furniture and equipment is updated, but carpet and wallpaper need replacement - somewhat dated. The shower head is low and I had to bend my knees - I'm only 5'9". During the night, you'll hear every door nearby shut. If you're a light sleeper in a busy floor, this will be a problem. I had breakfast and lunch at Ingredients - main floor restaurant. I found this self service restaurant to be excellent with lots of variety with fresh food such as eggs to order, make your own salad, and very reasonable prices. The self seating area is vast and plentiful. For me, this was the best aspect of the hotel.
reviews.title: Simply average, but comfortable

reviews.text: “Everything was great. One staff member I met in the hallway. I asked him how he was doing today. He said living the dream and loving my job. That meant a lot to me.”
reviews.title: Very well taken care of.

reviews.text: My wife and I had decided to cut in half a long trip to buy a used car by staying at this hotel for the night, even though it's only two hours from our home, reasoning that it was alright to treat ourselves since our anniversary was also the next day. We couldn't have made a better decision, and the "special-ness" of it was greatly enhanced because of the initiative of the you g woman, Julie, working check-in when we got there. We are
reviews.title: Treated extra special, thanks to Julie!

reviews.text: Centrally located, with a friendly, professional staff. I've always found my room to be clean and comfortable and the gym is very nice and well stocked with modern equipment, free headphones, towels and water. This particular stay I noticed that the bath faucet was loose and the tub could have used a more thorough scrubbing, but I mentioned those problems to management upon checking out and they promised to have them fixed right away.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Cincinnati

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I always feel safe, comfortable and well cared for at this Westin, and the oatmeal and cafe au lait in the lobby restaurant, Ingredients, is my favorite breakfast on the road.
reviews.title: Wedding and years later, aniversary!

reviews.text: I had my wedding at the Westin and it was magical, they made sure everything was as perfect as possible. And it was. it was beatiful and chic. Years later we went back for our anniversary, and it was as wonderful!!! Everybody is extremely nice and they try everything to make you feel welcome and comfortable!!! Friends sent wine and cheese to our bedroom, and they took care of it perfectly!!! It was very professional, and the way they prepare everything for us before we got to the room was excelent!!! It is a wonderful, wonderful place!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in a Great City!

reviews.text: I recently visited friends in Cincinnati and chose the Westin Hotel because of its brand reputation and location. The hotel is in excellent condition with an obvious comittment to attention to detail and cleanliness. The guest room was well appointed and the furnishings were fantastic! The room and other area's were spotless. The Westin "Heavenly Bed" was wonderful and they have "Service Express" to accomodate any request in a friendly, professional, expeditious manner. The staff at the Front Desk was fantastic at check-in explaining the hotel features and even taking time to provide information about parking and cost effective options to me. I had a scrumtious breakfast the next morning and again the service was Excellent, friendly and professional. My bill and check-out were perfect. This hotel is filled with wonderful employees and is well run by the management there. I was also impressed with the downtown area which is vibrant and had a safe feel to the environment. It has been 20 years since I have been to the city but I was so impressed with its transformation that I plan to visit the city and hotel again soon!
reviews.title: Terrible noise from connecting rooms

reviews.text: Great city and Excellent hotel!
reviews.title: Luxury in center city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room at the Westin for the weekend. It had been unseasonably warm on the day of our check-in. We checked in and went to our room. The sun had been shining in through the large window and the room was very warm. We turned down the temperature and headed off to dinner thinking it would improve by the time we returned. Upon our return the room temperature was in the upper 80's and unbearable. We called the front desk and they said they would send an engineer up to take a look. The engineer came up and told us that the hotel does not have any air-conditioning in the winter months and nothing could be done except opening the drapes. He also sent up a fan. We tried to sleep but at 1 AM I called the front desk and told them we would not be staying another night in the same room and that for the money we would have been more comfortable at a Microtel or Super 8 Motel. They said to come to the desk first thing in the morning and they would give us another room. Showed up at the desk by 8:00 AM and was told that they would move our luggage to our new room immediately. I told them we were leaving town for the day and would not return until late. When we returned around 11:00 PM we went to our new room and none of our belongings had been moved. Called the front desk and they could not find our luggage. Waited almost an hour until our luggage was found and delivered to us. We were grateful to check out the next day--could not get out of there fast enough. The Westin brand has really lost its edge--it really isn't anything out of the ordinary.
reviews.title: A Miserable Stay...

reviews.text: I absolutely love this hotel but the staff even more! I have stayed here on numerous occasions but this time I was launching a new book complete with an event with various and unexpected changes.
reviews.title: Book Launch

reviews.text: Not only was my stay great but the staff handled my last minute and urgent request with smiles and suggestions. They indeed contributed to the success of my event with attention to detail that exceeded a demanding persons expectation.
reviews.title: Stay when in Cinci

reviews.text: The room was, as always clean, well appointed and left alone per my wishes. I know whenever I stay at this property my focus can be on my agenda because from the check in to the check out, they make you feel like a V.I.P. and I kinda' like that.
reviews.title: Hospitality Driven all the way!!!

reviews.text: Good hotel in the heart of the City; near everything you need to go to. The attached mall is a nice touch. My only complaint was that the wifi service in the rooms was below average, which is tough for the business traveler.
reviews.title: By far the very best hotel in downtown Cincinnati.

description: Overlooking historic Fountain Square and located in the heart of downtown Cincinnati, Ohio, The Westin Cincinnati is the perfect destination for both leisure and business travel.
